availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Volney Hall (Farmer, Audrain Co, MO, + Harrison Co. KY)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, and Audrain County, Missouri, farmer. Harrison County, Kentucky, native. Son of Jesse Hall. Married to Nancy J. Odor Hall in Harrison County, Kentucky, on July 24, 1855. Father of Ella Z. Hall, James W. Hall, Alexander Hall, Thomas Hall, Jeremiah Hall, and Mary Hall. With his father, Jesse Hall, farmer in Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eighteen enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1850. Farmer in Cuivre, Missouri, in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Cuivre in 1860. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 2, p. 240B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 2, p. 445.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Missouri, Audrain County, Cuivre, p. 760.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Missouri, Audrain County, Cuivre, p. 11B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Berrys District, p. 79B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994037, Harrison County Marriages.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Harrison County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 199.
